H0.text: Element is the kind of substance that a mineral such as silver contains only one kind of.

H1.text: Matter is the type of substance that silver, a mineral containing only one kind of element, consists of.

H2.text: Mass is the kind of property that silver, as a mineral, contains only one kind of.

H3.text: Chemical is the kind that silver is an example of a mineral containing only one kind of.

A4.text: Silver is a chemical element; it has symbol Ag (from Latin argentum 'silver') and atomic number 47.
